reqsimile.data
Class ReqDataModel

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      reqsimile.data.ReqDataModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.table.TableModel
public class ReqDataModel
extends javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel

ReqDataModel is the middle layer between the actual data and a table in the user interface. It provides a JTable with the data to present in the table and fetches that data from an associated data set instaniated from ReqData.

(ReqData) => (ReqDataModel) => (JTable)

The class is designed to provide the data for all table views, both the summary view (list of requirements) and the detail view (requirements details). This has made several methods rather complicated and it would be a good idea to split it up for easier maintenance.

Since:
1.4.2
Author:
Johan Natt och Dag
See Also:
ReqData, Serialized Form

setReqLinks

public void setReqLinks(int markedKey,
                        int reqSet,
                        java.util.HashMap links)
Sets which requirements in the data model that are linked to the other requirements set. It is used to color the

Parameters:
markedKey - The key of the requirement for which similar requirements are currently shown. This is used to show requirements that are linked to this requirement in a different color.
reqSet - The id of the requirements set to which this set is linked. (i.e. the requirements set from which similar requirements are currently shown)
links - The set of requirements that are linked. The set also conatins information on either (1) how many requirements that are linked to each requirement. (2) The link status (see declaration).

increaseLinkStatus

public void increaseLinkStatus(java.lang.Integer key)
Adds a link to a requirement in the data model. If there already exists a link to that requirement, the link count is increased.

Parameters:
key - A unique requirements key

decreaseLinkStatus

public void decreaseLinkStatus(java.lang.Integer key)
Decreases the number of links to a requirement in the data model. If the number of links becomes 0, the link is completely removed from the set of link set.

Parameters:
key - A unique requirements key

Changes the link status between the currently marked row and a specified row. Also updates the link database to instantly reflect the changes.

Parameters:
row - A row in the data model for which the links status

setRowMap

public void setRowMap(int[] rows)
Sets row references to a number of rows in the underlying data set. This is used to display a subset of the rows from the data set. If this is set, the data model will provide the summary view.

Parameters:
rows - Array of references to the rows in the underlying data set

getLinkStatus

public int getLinkStatus(int row)
Returns the link status for a specified row. This is used for the result view only and the status is interpreted binary: 00 - not used (link removed from list) 01 - linked to marked requirement only 10 - linked to another requirement only 11 - linked to both another and the marked requirements

Parameters:
row - A row in the table model
Returns:
The link status

updateRowReferenceArray

public void updateRowReferenceArray()
Builds a helper array with all rows in the underlying data set

See Also:
showZeroSimilarity()

showZeroSimilarity

public void showZeroSimilarity()
Adds all rows in the underlying data set that is currently not referred to by the data model. This is used to add all requirements that were assigned zero similarity to the end of the resulting list of similar requirements.
